varikondo 0.3.1

Parse a VCF file and return a data frame with standardised fields across callers to use for caller comparison.

Source: R/parse_vcf_output.R
parse_vcf_output.Rd

Currently, it doesn't work for somatic calls and for VCF from the following callers: GATK3 MuTect2, VarScan2 and VarDict. It used the Bioconductor package `VariantAnnotation` to read `VCF` files into `R`.

parse_vcf_output(vcf_path, sample_name, caller, vep = TRUE)

Arguments

vcf_path

path to where the `.vcf` file for one sample is saved.
sample_name

character. Sample name of the current `vcf` file.
caller

character. One of `mutect`, `vardict` or `varscan`.
vep

logical. If TRUE, the annotation fields added by the Variant Effect Predictor will be parsed.

Examples

vcf_path <- system.file("extdata", "germline_mutect.vcf", package = "varikondo")
parsed_vcf_mutect <- varikondo::parse_vcf_output(annot_vcf_mutect,
caller = "mutect",
sample_name = "Sample1",
vep = TRUE)
#> Error in VariantAnnotation::readVcf(vcf_path): object 'annot_vcf_mutect' not found
